name: Composite ID with Check Digit
description: The CK data type is used to represent identification numbers that include an embedded check digit for validation purposes. It combines a unique identifier with a mathematically calculated check digit to detect data entry errors and ensure data integrity. CK is commonly used for patient identifiers, medical record numbers, and other critical healthcare identification numbers where accuracy is essential for patient safety and operational efficiency.

CK.1.name: ID Number
CK.1.description: The base identification number without the check digit. This is the core identifier that uniquely identifies the entity within the system.

CK.2.name: Check Digit
CK.2.description: The mathematically calculated check digit used to validate the ID number. Computed using algorithms such as Luhn, modulus 10, or modulus 11 to detect transcription errors.

CK.3.name: Code Identifying Check Digit Scheme
CK.3.description: Identifies the specific algorithm or scheme used to calculate the check digit (e.g., M10 for modulus 10, M11 for modulus 11, NPI for National Provider Identifier validation).

CK.4.name: Assigning Authority
CK.4.description: The organization or system responsible for assigning and maintaining the identification number. Provides context for the scope and authority of the identifier.

constraints.validation: Check digit must be mathematically valid according to the specified scheme
constraints.algorithm: Check digit scheme must reference a recognized validation algorithm
constraints.consistency: ID number and check digit must form a valid combination

generationHints.typical: Generate realistic ID numbers with mathematically correct check digits

implementationNotes.validation: Systems should validate check digits before processing to catch data entry errors
implementationNotes.algorithms: Support common check digit algorithms (Modulus 10, Modulus 11, Luhn)
implementationNotes.performance: Check digit validation adds processing overhead but improves data quality
implementationNotes.fallback: Systems should handle cases where check digit validation fails gracefully
implementationNotes.standardization: Use consistent check digit schemes across the organization for similar identifier types
